image.altText: The legs of a person in yellow chains as other people hold him down.

props.synopsis: A 17-year-old who repeatedly assaulted jail staff after being unlawfully locked in his cell for 24-hour periods had not received adequate care from the justice system, a judge finds as he is jailed for a further 12 months.

title.children: 'Turn your cameras off and bash me': CCTV gives confronting insight into WA's youth detention

image.altText: A still image taken from CCTV showing three teenagers standing on a street near a man on the ground, with identities blurred.

props.synopsis: An 11-year-old boy is charged after allegedly assaulting a 69-year-old man who police say was repeatedly punched and kicked by a group of males and left lying injured in the street outside his Bentley home.

title.children: Police say 69yo Perth man bashed after trying to stop group throwing rocks at neighbour's house

image.altText: A group of people swimming in clear blue water

props.synopsis: As Perth and parts of Western Australia swelter through a second heatwave in as many weeks, data shows hot weather has left almost five times more people in hospital than bushfires in recent years.

title.children: People flock to the coast as another heatwave scorches Perth and parts of WA

image.altText: Custody photo of an Aboriginal man, staring directly into the camera.

props.synopsis: Warrick Walkerbear, who is serving time for the manslaughter of his partner, Ms Waterloo, led police on a three-day manhunt after escaping Broome Regional Prison in 2021.

title.children: Broome prison escapee who walked through unlocked door given additional four months' jail

image.altText: A four-storey hospital building with a Bethesda sign out the front.

props.synopsis: Amber-Jade Sanderson says private health insurers and the federal government need to help improve coverage for mental health care after a Perth clinic closed because it was not financially viable.

title.children: Private mental health clinic's closure less than a year after it opened sparks plea for help

image.altText: Jess Murphy crying, standing in front of her dad.

props.synopsis: Jess Murphy says she knows her mum is out there as she addresses media in a desperate bid to help the search for missing Ballarat woman Samantha Murphy.

title.children: 'Mum please come home soon': Daughter of missing Ballarat woman Samantha Murphy makes tearful plea

image.altText: Russian soldiers in a military airplane with African locals standing nearby.

props.synopsis: The Wagner group was infamous for doing Russia's bidding across Africa but now a new organisation loyal to Vladimir Putin is infiltrating the region's coup belt.

title.children: Wagner group defied Putin in Russia, now he's replacing them in Africa

image.altText: John Setka sitting behind a number of microphones at a Melbourne media conference.

props.synopsis: Controversial construction union boss John Setka announces he will retire from the role by the end of 2024.

title.children: Union boss John Setka set to retire from CFMEU

image.altText: Two police walk towards the gate in a brick fence

props.synopsis: Child abuse investigators are scouring the home of former bishop Christopher Saunders for the second time in a month, as part of a long-running inquiry into sexual assault allegations made by young men.

title.children: Police return to former Bishop of Broome's home over child sexual abuse allegations

image.altText: package with barnacles and aerial shot of cheynes beach

props.synopsis: A member of the public found the package which was wrapped in plastic and covered in shells and barnacles.

title.children: Barnacle-encrusted brick of cocaine washes up at popular WA tourist beach

image.altText: Teenagers in white and black school uniforms walk along a black fence.

props.synopsis: A mould infestation at a Broken Hill high school is so severe the NSW Department of Education has declared it too dangerous for students to return, forcing them to start term one scattered around different campuses.

title.children: Concerns for outback students' mental health as mould infestation disrupts start to school year

image.altText: albanese sits with his hands on his hips, watching dutton speak across the dispatch box

props.synopsis: The prime minister, obviously, is now wagering that people won't mind him breaking a promise if it lands them some extra cash in their pockets, write Annabel Crabb and Brett Worthington.

title.children: 'My word is my bond' and other one liners that seemed like a good idea at the time

image.altText: A woman with cropped red hair looks off to the side

props.synopsis: US Fed member Loretta Mester says investors may have expected a rate cut in the US in March, but she wants to see more signs that inflation is definitely downwards before rates are lowered, and we're not there yet.

title.children: 'The market got ahead of itself': US Fed member joins central bank chorus pushing back on rate cut hopes

image.altText: Robodebt

props.synopsis: Four current or former public servants have breached the Australian Public Service code of conduct in relation to the Robodebt scheme, according to the preliminary findings of an independent investigation.

title.children: Four public servants found to have breached APS Code of Conduct over Robodebt

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt is surrounded by reporters with microphones and cameras.

props.synopsis: The NT workplace safety watchdog accuses Matt Wright of interfering with flight record data following a crash that killed his Netflix co-star Chris "Willow" Wilson in 2022.

title.children: Netflix star Matt Wright and company Helibrook accused of falsifying flight records

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: black discs floating in a dam

props.synopsis: In its latest effort to shore-up supply, Water Corporation is adding thousands of plastic hexagons to dams to stop drinking water from being lost to evaporation.

title.children: Under a sweltering WA summer could these hexagonal discs save the drinking water of towns?

image.altText: A South Australian cricketer is on all fours on the grass during a match, with blood coming from his nose.

props.synopsis: Henry Hunt was out for five in the third over, left the ground early after copping a ball to the face, and his Redbacks lost to Victoria at Junction Oval.

title.children: South Australian star left bloodied after copping slog to the face in one-day loss

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt being escorted by a detective in plain clothes.

props.synopsis: The Mackay parents, accused of murdering their two-year-old daughter by denying her medical treatment, also allegedly failed to register her birth, a court has heard.

title.children: Parents who allegedly killed their child by denying her medical treatment appear in Queensland court

image.altText: the back of a white ute with oct7th number plate

props.synopsis: NSW Premier Chris Minns says the 'OCT7TH' number plates spotted on a white ute are "disgusting" and were issued in error.

title.children: Chris Minns lambasts 'sick person' using 'OCT7TH' number plates as Sydney motorist is ordered to surrender them

image.altText: Members of the public at a crowded beach during sunset.

props.synopsis: Global temperatures through January have been the hottest on record, extending the run of unprecedented temperatures to eight months. For Australia, it's the third hottest January on record.

title.children: Run of unprecedented temperatures continues after warmest January on record

image.altText: Kurtley Beale arrives at the Downing Centre District Court in Sydney, Friday, February 2, 2024

props.synopsis: Kurtley Beale's barrister in her closing argument to the jury says her client's accuser made a "false" allegation of sexual assault.

title.children: Kurtley Beale's barrister says his accuser is a 'manipulative woman' who turned herself into 'victim'

image.altText: A white roof and the tops of trees peak out of green-brown floodwater, with mountains in the background.

props.synopsis: Residents in Timber Creek and Bulla say "the food wasn't coming" during their recent three-week isolation. Things got so bad, neighbours chartered their own helicopter for a food run, and a cattle station donated a freshly killed carcass.

title.children: Top End communities cut off by flooding for weeks 'disgusted' by lack of government support

image.altText: Penny Wong standing at a podium.

props.synopsis: The foreign minister says she has spoken with the United Nations aid agency in Gaza as new reports emerge questioning Israel's claims that its staff were involved in the October 7 terrorist attacks.

title.children: Wong speaks with UNRWA after reports emerge questioning Israel's claims its staff are involved with Hamas

image.altText: man standing outside building

props.synopsis: Michael Katsidis, who won the WBO interim lightweight championship in 2007, will walk free from custody after serving nearly two years in jail.

title.children: Former Australian boxing champ pleads guilty to drug trafficking, will walk free from jail

image.altText: woman holding candle

props.synopsis: Child sex abuse survivor Kezia Whitton says she was shocked to learn an elder from her former church had provided a character reference for her abuser. But the religious leader is defending his actions.

title.children: Jehovah's Witness elder called out for providing court character reference for child abuser

image.altText: James Marape salutes as he walks past defence personnel outside parliament house.

props.synopsis: The Prime Minister of Papua New Guinea James Marape urges Australia to not "give up" on his country during an historic address to the federal parliament.

title.children: 'Do not give up on Papua New Guinea': PNG prime minister addresses parliament in historic speech

image.altText: a woman speaking into a media microphone

props.synopsis: The daughter of a 70-year-old woman who was stabbed to death in a shopping centre car park, says her mother "loved everybody" and urged people not to "judge the whole community by a couple of bad apples".

title.children: 'Don't judge the whole community by a couple of bad apples': Stab victim daughter's plea for unity

image.altText: Police cordon off a train station

props.synopsis: With Kalgoorlie-Boulder the latest city to receive emergency police resources, remote residents say WA's justice system needs a new approach to fix deep-seated problems.

title.children: Calls grow for tougher court sentences across regional WA — but would it help lower crime?

image.altText: A projected aerial view of the Gabba Stadium

props.synopsis: International Olympic Committee vice president John Coates says he's told the independent committee reviewing the Games master plan to "abandon" the Gabba.

title.children: Minister denies 2032 Olympics 'on the nose' after IOC's John Coates urges Gabba rejection

image.altText: Broome will be serviced by a full-time Qantas engineer after multiple flight cancellations from the town's airport

props.synopsis: Union pilots working for Qantas subsidiary Network Aviation will not fly for 24 hours in Western Australia as their protracted negotiations with the airline hit another stalemate.

title.children: Travellers, FIFO workers brace for delays as WA pilots take industrial action

image.altText: A mother and baby.

props.synopsis: Cases of whooping cough are surging across Australia, with an infectious disease expert warning that the respiratory disease is "back with a vengeance".

title.children: Baby Daisy's whooping cough put her in hospital, and experts warn cases are on the rise

image.altText: A polar bear carves out a bed from a small iceberg before drifting off to sleep in the far north, off Norway

props.synopsis: Photographer Nima Sarikhani watched the bear for eight hours in Norway’s Svalbard archipelago before taking the photo.

title.children: Snap of polar bear napping on iceberg wins People's Choice Award

image.altText: workers in orange protective gear construct a steel building frame overlooking the sea in Antarctica.

props.synopsis: China opens its fifth Antarctic research station, starting operations in an outpost due south of Australia and New Zealand for the first time.

title.children: China opens Antarctic research station due south of Australia, begins operations for the first time

image.altText: A search information board.

props.synopsis: The family and friends of Ballarat woman Samantha Murphy say they've been touched by the way the community has united to search for the 51-year-old, who disappeared during a Sunday morning jog.

title.children: In the bush and online, Ballarat is rallying to find missing mother Samantha Murphy
